alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 5:35PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Grand. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tonahutu Creek, Pole Creek, East Inlet, Colorado River, Grouse Creek, North Inlet, Ranger Creek, Soda Creek, Twin Creek, Middle Saint Vrain Creek, Columbine Creek, North Saint Vrain Creek, Echo Creek, Buchanan Creek and Roaring Fork Arapaho Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Lake and Allenspark. - This includes the following additional locations... North Inlet in Grand Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows in steep terrain.
